comment: This guy is the worse prof ever. If you already know the info take him. But if you need some explanation take someone who will teach you. He does not teach he assigns problems and moves at lightning speed.Gives test every 2 weeks starting after the first week of class.

Mr. Anderson does not teach he just gives problems. Then he gets mad if you ask him a question and you do not understand it after his attempt to explain the problem. Which is about one sentence that makes no sense. His book was not posted until the day before the class started and he still assigned homework from the book on the first day of class.

if you already know dynamics. take this class cuz this guys tests arent all that hard and he curves like crazy but obviously the reason you take the class is to learn it and with Anderson your better off just trying to learn it yourself. he is the most useless professor.Ya hes nice and all and will make you giggle every once in a while.But thats it
In case you didn't hear this advice from your friends: "Do not take it with Dr Anderson!"

The poster that said this guy is good must be his mom. Lectures are not clear. Does not prepare for class. Cannot work homework problems out on the board, and get the correct answer. Test problems are from outer space. Highest class average below a 60. No one passes without a curve. FYI I passed the FE exam.

OHH i had it with him this is the second time taking this class and I passed with a C. he does not explain anything, and when he does he spines your head to places that they were not there an then says finish up the last part. I will not take him again, i took it with Nasseri and I wish If I had stayed with here she really puts on effort.

Good professor. He is helpful to students and will listen to their questions and answer them to the best of his ability. Grading is based only on exams. Take this professor if you are willing to learn, will do your homework, and are decent at taking tests.

Anderson is in his own world and doesn't care about a students progress in class. Either right or wrong answers on exam no feed back to gauge wrather a student is making mistakes and why. It's all about him not a good professor at all. He doesn't explain a good approach to problems/too much concept! AVOID!

Anderson's problem is that he doesn't want to be a professor. How do I know? Because everyone struggles with his tests and he doesn't even make you show your work. Your answer is either right or wrong. Well Anderson I'd like to know: How can you become a better teacher if you don't even know what mistakes your students are making? Seems illogical.

First time I took this guy I had it in for him.  Just stop and listen to him.  This guy has more patents in his name than anyone teaching at the school.  Practically developed half the mechanics graduate courses at Georgia Tech.  Lot to be learned from him.

he sucks, doesnt know what he is doing. test are not like homework. cannot solve problems he assigns. Take all class to do one problem. doesnt lecture just tries and fails to solve problems. no partial credit on tests. test are ridiculously hard. he is a smoker and his breath stinks bad. hasnt teached for 20years. overall not a good teacher.
toughest teacher i've ever had.  tests suck big time.  he couldn't even work them out in the time required.  phd req'd for good grade in his class.  AVOID IF AT ALL POSSIBLE.
Nice guy, but avoid at all cost.
Not good at teaching material. I learned more from the book. No partial credit on tests, but gives a decent curve.
